page.title: 18A1 MOTORWAY
page.content: Section of road 24km long between Blythe(Sth) and Red House(Nth), known as the Doncaster Bypass.Second stretch of motorway in U.K.Opened by Ernest Marples M.P. in Sept 1961,to alleviate traffic congestion in Doncaster. Cost Â£15m. Now maintained by S.Y.C.C. at a cost of Â£400,000 p.a. and 12 men work on it.11,500 vehicles pass every 12 hrs.There is at least one accident per day and 2-3 fatalities a year.Bridges: 18 over,13 under.Animals seen include badger,fox,owl,kestrel.Plant life is most varied of any motorway stretch in country. Problems:pedestrians,U-turns, cyclists,wrong carriageway,travellers. Litter:15 ton ingot,cows,pigs,sheep, tractor cabs,beer,timber,clothing. In 1963 some people jumped over Don viaduct to escape cars in fog.Fall is 100 ft.In 1984 large articulated lorry drove over viaduct.Driver was unhurt.
